thread.title: Nissan jobs boost: social media reaction from across the North East
thread.title_full: Nissan jobs boost: social media reaction from across the North East

author: Sean Seddon
title: Nissan jobs boost: social media reaction from across the North East
text:
The announcement will be especially welcome to the 7,000 workers already employed at the site. Read More 
As well as the direct employees, 28,000 work in a supply chain which serves production. 
But some have asked questions about the nature of the deal between Nissan and the government. Read More 
It is unclear exactly what has been agreed between the two but it has led to a dramatic turnaround. 
Nissan have been consistently and publicly uncomfortable about the prospect of the UK leaving the EU. 
The automotive industry stands to be hit by big tariffs unless access to the single market is retained or a similar deal is struck. I agree with @carryonkeith . Good for Nissan workers & ppl in Sunderland, but automotive ind has warned that they may have to relocate to EU — June Turnbull (@socialist1959) 27 October 2016 
However, others have been heartened by the news and wondered if Brexit is going to be as negative for the economy as they thought. Read More 
Sunderland was the first area in mainland UK to vote for Leave so it’s ironic one of the first big pieces of post-Brexit good news should also be Sunderland-related too. Fantastic news about Nissan. Hold my hands up and say maybe I was wrong about #Brexit
